intro: Andryala pinnatifida subsp. buchiana, commonly known as the Buchian lily, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a short, stout rhizome. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
